briefTitle: Assessing the Safety/Efficacy of Asacol® Given Every 12 Hours to Children and Adolescents With Active Ulcerative Colitis
officialTitle: Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Asacol® (1.2 to 4.8 g/Day) Administered as 400 mg Delayed-release Tablets Given Every 12 Hours for 6 Weeks to Children and Adolescents With Mildly-to-Moderately Active Ulcerative Colitis
summary: The overall objective of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of high dose and low dose Asacol administered as 400 mg delayed-release tablets given every 12 hours for 6 weeks to children and adolescents with mildly-to-moderately active ulcerative colitis.

primaryOutcome.measure: Treatment Success PUCAI (Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis Activity Index), mITT/Modified Intent to Treat Population
